name: Amlodipine Besylate

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

indications.text: amlodipine besylate , usp calcium channel blocker may used alone combination antihypertensive antianginal agents treatment : hypertension ( 1.1 ) amlodipine besylate tablets , usp indicated treatment hypertension , lower blood pressure . lowering blood pressure reduces risk fatal nonfatal cardiovascular events , primarily strokes myocardial infarctions . coronary artery disease ( 1.2 ) chronic stable angina vasospastic angina ( prinzmetal 's variant angina ) angiographically documented coronary artery disease patients without heart failure ejection fraction < 40 %

contraindications.text: adult recommended starting dose : 5 mg daily maximum dose 10 mg daily . ( 2.1 ) small , fragile , elderly patients , patients hepatic insufficiency may started 2.5 mg daily . ( 2.1 ) pediatric starting dose : 2.5 mg 5 mg daily . ( 2.2 ) important limitation : doses excess 5 mg daily studied pediatric patients . ( 2.2 )

warningsAndPrecautions: 5 mg tablets amlodipine besylate-5 mg tablets ( amlodipine besylate , usp equivalent 5 mg amlodipine per tablet ) supplied white , round , flat faced beveled edged tablets debossed ig one side 238 supplied follows : ndc 68645-515-54 bottle 30 10 mg tablets amlodipine besylate-10 mg tablets ( amlodipine besylate , usp equivalent 10 mg amlodipine per tablet ) supplied white , round , flat faced beveled edged tablets debossed ig one side 239 supplied follows : ndc 68645-516-54 bottle 30 storage store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight , light-resistant containers ( usp ) . revised : 06/2020
indications_original: Amlodipine besylate, USP is a calcium channel blocker and may be used alone or in combination with other antihypertensive and antianginal agents for the treatment of: Hypertension ( 1.1 ) Amlodipine besylate tablets, USP are indicated for the treatment of hypertension, to lower blood pressure. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and nonfatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions. Coronary Artery Disease ( 1.2 ) Chronic Stable Angina Vasospastic Angina (Prinzmetal's or Variant Angina) Angiographically Documented Coronary Artery Disease in patients without heart failure or an ejection fraction < 40%
contraindications_original: Adult recommended starting dose: 5 mg once daily with maximum dose 10 mg once daily. ( 2.1 ) Small, fragile, or elderly patients, or patients with hepatic insufficiency may be started on 2.5 mg once daily. ( 2.1 ) Pediatric starting dose: 2.5 mg to 5 mg once daily. ( 2.2 ) Important Limitation: Doses in excess of 5 mg daily have not been studied in pediatric patients. ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
5 mg Tablets 
                  
                  Amlodipine besylate-5 mg Tablets (amlodipine besylate, USP equivalent to 5 mg of amlodipine per tablet) are supplied as white, round, flat faced beveled edged tablets debossed with 
  IG on one side and 
  238 on the other and supplied as follows:
 
                  NDC 68645-515-54 Bottle of 30
                  
                     10 mg Tablets 
                  
                  Amlodipine besylate-10 mg Tablets (amlodipine besylate, USP equivalent to 10 mg of amlodipine per tablet) are supplied as white, round, flat faced beveled edged tablets debossed with 
  IG on one side and 
  239 on the other and supplied as follows:
 
                  NDC 68645-516-54 Bottle of 30
                  
                     Storage 
                  
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Dispense in tight, light-resistant containers (USP).
                  
                  Revised: 06/2020
